subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But we have this treasure in jars of clay to show that this all-surpassing power is from God and not from us. (2 Cor. 4:7) NIV
reflection: The valuable treasure we have is the message of salvation in Jesus Christ, which has been entrusted by God to us frail human beings (jars of clay). We see that Paul's focus, was not on the perishable container but on its priceless contents ~ God's power dwelling in us. Though we are weak, God uses us to spread His Good News, and He gives us power to do His work. Knowing the power is His, not ours, should keep us from pride and motivate us to keep daily contact with God, our power source. Our responsibility is to let people see God through us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for another day of grace, I pray that today I would be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. I pray that my actions today would reflect my love for You in such a way that others would be drawn to You, I pray for that power. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: We are hard pressed on every side, but not crushed; perplexed, but not in despair; Persecuted, but not abandoned; struck down, but not destroyed. We always carry around in our body the death of Jesus, so that the life of Jesus may always be revealed in our body. For we who are alive are always being given over to death for Jesus sake, so that His life may be revealed in our mortal body. So then, death is at work in us, but life is at work in You. (2 Cor 4:8-12) NIV
reflection: Paul reminds us that though we may feel we are at the end of our rope, we are never at the end of hope. Our perishable body is subject to sin and suffering, but God never abandons us. Because Christ has won the victory over death, we have eternal life. All our risks, humiliation, and trails are opportunities for Christ to demonstrate His power and presence in and through us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I often have felt as though I was at the end of my rope, but as I recall Ps. 50:15 I am strengthened again, for as You say in that text, "Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor me." So today once again I give You thanks, for You are a Great and Awesome God. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day. (2 Cor. 4:16) NIV
reflection: Sometimes it is very easy to lose heart and quit. We have all had problems in our relationships or in our work that have caused us to think about giving up. BUT rather than quitting when persecution wore him down, Paul concentrated on the inner strength that came from the Holy Spirit (Eph. 3:16). Don't let fatigue, pain or criticism force you off the job. renew your commitment to serving Christ. Don't forsake your eternal reward because of the intensity of today's pain. Your very weakness allows the resurrection power of Christ to strengthen you moment by moment.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for throwing up my hands and giving into the trials of the day. Help me to remember that in You there is an abundance of strength for those who will call upon You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For our light and momentary troubles are achieving for us an eternal glory the outweighs them all. (2 Cor. 4:17) NIV
reflection: Our troubles should not diminish our faith or disillusions us. We should realize that there is a purpose for our suffering. Problems and human limitations have several benefits. (1) They should remind us of Christ's suffering for us; (2) They should keep us from pride; (3) They should cause us to look beyond this brief life; (4) They should give us opportunities to prove our faith to others; and (5) They should give God the opportunity to demonstrate His power. Let us remember to see our troubles as opportunities.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for added faith and trust in You. Help me to see what You are trying to teach me in times of trouble. Forgive me for the lack of faith. Amen.

Let us pray that we will be joined by all our family members in that place.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus I thank You for the promise of a better life after death ~ a place prepared by You ~ a place where there will be no more sin and pain ~ where we will live with You forever. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Since, then, we know what it is to fear the Lord, we try to persuade men. What we are is plain to God, and I hope it is also plain to your conscience. We are not trying to commend ourselves to you again, but are giving you an opportunity to take pride in us, so that you can answer those who take pride in what is seen rather than in what is in the heart. (2 Cor. 5:11-12) NIV
reflection: What Paul is attempting to say is: Those who "brag about having a spectacular ministry rather than having a sincere heart before God" are the false preachers (2 Cor. 2:17). They are the preachers who were, and are, concerned only about getting ahead in this world. They were, and are, preaching the Good News for money and popularity. Paul and his companions were preaching out of concern for eternity. We can identify false preachers by finding out what really motivates them. If they are more concerned about themselves than about Christ, avoid them and their message.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to remain more concerned about the truth being shared with others than I am about my own needs. Let me not be a stumbling block to my brothers and sisters in the Lord. Amen.

reflection: When one accepts Christ as their Savior they become new people on the inside. The Holy Spirit gives them a new life, and they are not the same anymore. We are not reformed, rehabilitated, or reeducated ~ we are re-created (new creations), living in vital union with Christ (Col. 2:6, 7). At conversion we do not merely turn over a new leaf, we began a new life under a new Master.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for making it possible for me to have a new life ~ a life serving You each day. Help me Lord to continue in a living relationship with You. Amen.

verse: God made Him who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in Him we might become the righteousness of God. (2 Cor. 5:21) NIV
reflection: When we trust in Christ, we make an exchange: He takes our sin and makes us right with God. Our sin was laid on Christ at His crucifixion. His righteousness is given to us at our conversion. This is what is meant by Christ's atonement for sin. In the world bartering works only when two people exchange goods of similar value. BUT God offers to trade his righteousness for our sin something of immeasurable worth, for something completely worthless. OH how grateful we should be for His kindness to us.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I do thank you for Your immeasurable love that You were willing to make an atonement for my sin through the blood of Christ. I pray for Your Holy Spirit's leading and guiding. Help me to walk in a closer walk with thee. Amen.

verse: In truthful speech and in the power of God; with weapons of righteousness in the right hand and in the left; through glory and dishonor, bad report and good report; genuine, yet regarded as impostors; known yet regarded as unknown; dying, and yet we live on; beaten, and yet not killed; sorrowful, yet always rejoicing; poor, yet making many rich; having nothing, and yet possessing everything. reflection: What a difference it makes to know Jesus! He cares for us in spite of what the world thinks. Christians don't have to give in to public opinion and pressure. prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, forgive me for those times that I have not remained as faithful as I should. I thank You for Your wondrous love in spite of my unfaithfulness. Amen.

We need an open ratter than a closed heart toward God's message.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be more receptive to Your leading and guiding. Help me to have a sensitive heart and spirit to Your Word I pray in Jesus name. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Do not be yoked together with unbelievers. For what do righteousness and wickedness have in common? Or what fellowship can light have with darkness? What harmony is there between Christ and Beliah? What does a believer have in common with an unbeliever? What agreement is there between the temple of God and idols? For we are the temple of the living God. As God has said: "I will live with them and walk among them, and I will be their God, and they will be My people" "therefore come out of them and be separate, says the Lord. Touch no unclean thing, and I will receive you." "I will be a Father to you, and you will be My sons and daughters, " says the Lord Almighty. (2 Cor. 6:14-18) NIV
reflection: Paul urges believers to not form partnerships with unbelievers because this might weaken their Christian commitment, integrity, or standards. It would be a mismatch. Earlier, Paul explained that this did not mean isolating oneself from unbelievers (see 1 Cor. 5:9, 10). Paul even urged Christians to stay with their unbelieving spouses (1 Cor. 7:12, 13). Paul wanted Christians to be active in their witness for Christ to unbelievers but not to lock themselves into personal or business relationships that could cause them to compromise their faith. Believers should do everything in their power to avoid situations that could force them into dividing their loyalties.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirits leading so that I would be aware of opportunities of witness for You. Help me to remain faithful so as to not be drawn into dividing my loyalty to You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Since we have these promises, dear friends, let us purify ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit, perfecting holiness out of reverence for God. (2 Cor. 7:1) NIV
reflection: Purifying ~~ or cleansing is a twofold action ~~ First: it is a turning away from sin ~~ Second: It is a turning to God. Perfecting Holiness: is the process of becoming more like Christ. The process will not become complete until we meet Christ face to face. But knowing that it is our ultimate destiny should motivate us to purify ourselves. Yes to purify means to keep morally straight, free from the corruption of sin. God also purifies us, but there is action we must take to remain morally fit ~~ (see I Tim 5:22; Jm. 4:8; 1 Pet. 1:22)
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, guide and direct me in paths of righteousness that I might become more Christ-like. Forgive me of my short-comings so that one day I will meet Christ face-to-face. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even if I caused you sorrow by my letter, I do not regret it. Though I did regret it ~ I see that my letter hurt you, but only for a little while ~ yet now I am happy, not because you were made sorry, but because your sorrow led you to repentance. For you became sorrowful as God intended and so were not harmed in any way by us. Godly sorrow brings repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regret, but worldly sorrow brings death. (2 Cor. 7:8-10) NIV
reflection: Sorrow for our sins can result in changed behavior. Many people are sorry only for the effects of their sins or for being caught ("sorrow without repentance"). Sometime compare Peter"s remorse with Judas's bitterness and the act of suicide. Both denied Christ. One repented and was restored to faith and service: the other took his own life.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for allowing us to come to You openly seeking Your divine forgiveness for our sins through Jesus Christ. Help me become more sensitive to my sinful nature. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: See what this godly sorrow has produced in you: what earnestness, what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing, what concern, what readiness to see justice done. At every point you have proved yourselves innocent in this matter. (2 Cor. 7:11) NIV
reflection: It is difficult to be confronted with our sins and even more difficult to get rid of sin. Paul praised the Corinthians for clearing up an especially troublesome situation (see 2:5-11). Do you tend to be defensive when confronted? Don't let pride keep you from admitting your sin. We need to accept correction as a tool for our growth, and do all we can to correct problems that are pointed out to us.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, Help me see the sins in my life that I covet. Help me to confess them and turn from them, that I might have a closer walk with you. Amen.
